q: President Bush at a Feb. 3, 2003, National Security Council meeting in which Colin Powell sketched out the presentation he was to make at the UN two days later. Donald Rumsfeld quotes himself as telling the meeting: We should hit Khurmal during the speech, given that Colin Powell will talk about it. Khurmal is the name of a village near the site. Colin Powell objected. In his UN presentation, Colin Powell described it as "Terrorist Poison and Explosive Factory, Khurmal." Donald Rumsfeld said Khurmal

This move is a big one for ol' Google, as Eric Schmidt , Page and Sergey Brin have long run the company as a trio, an approach Page articulated quite clearly in the company's 2004 IPO filing: We run Google as a triumvirate. The three of us run the company collaboratively with Sergey Brin and me as presidents. The structure is unconventional, but we have worked successfully in this way. Though it goes against Google's well-worn techniques, Shmidt claims the reorganization won't hurt the company's mojo. In fact, he believes the new management structure will speed up the decision making process.

These will be 8-to-10- megabit networks, roughly 10 times what we have today, which will usher in new and creative applications, mostly entertainment and social, for these phone platforms, Eric Schmidt wrote in a recent Harvard Business Review article.
